text:
One of the [[SPECIAL]] attributes. As such, its value is always an integer between 1 and 10 inclusive.

In-game description:

<<<
Coordination and the ability to move well. A high Agility is important for any active character.
<<<

Affects:

* [[ArmorClass]] statistic (if the [[Kamikaze]] trait is not active)
* [[ActionPoints]] statistic
* [[MeleeDamageBonus]] statistic
* [[SmallGuns]] skill
* [[BigGuns]] skill
* [[EnergyWeapons]] skill
* [[Unarmed]] skill
* [[MeleeWeapons]] skill
* [[Throwing]] skill
* [[Sneak]] skill
* [[Lockpick]] skill
* [[Steal]] skill
* [[Traps]] skill

Is affected by:

* [[SmallFrame]] trait (+1)
* [[Gifted]] trait (+1)
title: Agility

text:
A [[Trait]] affecting your [[Strength]] and [[ActionPoints]].

In-game description:

<<<
A little slower, but a little bigger. You may not hit as often, but they will feel it when you do! Your total action points are lowered, but your Strength is increased.
<<<

Positive effects:

* +2 [[Strength]]

Negative effects:

* -2 [[ActionPoints]]
title: Bruiser

text:
Carry weight is the amount of weight your character can hold in its inventory (sum of weights of all the items) before they will become [[Overencumbered]] and lose movement speed.

In-game description:

<<<
The maximum amount of equipment your character can carry, in pounds.
<<<

In normal circumstances, carry weight is calculated using this formula:
$$
\mathit{CarryWeight} = 25 + \mathit{Strength} \times 25
$$

If the character possesses the [[SmallFrame]] trait, it instead changes ([[FutureContent]]) to:
$$
\mathit{CarryWeight} = 25 + \mathit{Strength} \times 15
$$

Affects:

* [[MovementSpeed]] (movement on the map costs more [[Ticks|Tick]]) ([[FutureContent]])

Is affected by:

* [[Strength]] attribute (see formulas above)
* [[SmallFrame]] trait (see formulas above)
* [[PackRat]] perk (+50) ([[FutureContent]])
* [[StrongBack]] perk (+50 per rank) ([[FutureContent]])
title: CarryWeight

text:
One of the [[SPECIAL]] attributes. As such, its value is always an integer between 1 and 10 inclusive.

In-game description:

<<<
A combination of appearance and charm. A high Charisma is important for characters that want to influence people with words.
<<<

Affects:

* [[Speech]] skill
* [[Barter]] skill

Is affected by:

* [[Gifted]] trait (+1)
title: Charisma

text:
One of the [[SPECIAL]] attributes. As such, its value is always an integer between 1 and 10 inclusive.

In-game description:

<<<
Stamina and physical toughness. A character with a high Endurance will survive where others may not.
<<<

Affects:

* [[MaxHitpoints]] statistic
* [[HealingRate]] statistic
* [[Outdoorsman]] skill

Is affected by:

* [[Gifted]] trait (+1)
title: Endurance

text:
Gambling is a [[Skill]] related to [[Games]].

In-game description:

<<<
The knowledge and practical skills related to wagering. The skill at cards, dice and other games.
<<<

The skill is currently [[Useless]] as of [[2021.04.19::001]].
title: Gambling

text:
One of the [[SPECIAL]] attributes. As such, its value is always an integer between 1 and 10 inclusive.

In-game description:

<<<
Knowledge, wisdom and the ability to think quickly. A high Intelligence is important for any character.
<<<

Affects:

* [[SkillPoints|SkillPoint]] gained per level
* [[HealingRate]] statistic
* [[FirstAid]] skill
* [[Doctor]] skill
* [[Science]] skill
* [[Repair]] skill
* [[Outdoorsman]] skill

Is affected by:

* [[Gifted]] trait (+1)
title: Intelligence

text:
One of the [[SPECIAL]] attributes. As such, its value is always an integer between 1 and 10 inclusive.

In-game description:

<<<
Fate. Karma. An extremely high or low Luck will affect the character - somehow. Events and situations will be changed by how lucky (or unlucky) your character is.
<<<

Affects:

* [[Gambling]] skill

Is affected by:

* [[Gifted]] trait (+1)
title: Luck

text:
[[NuAshworld|https://nu-ashworld.lamdera.app]] is a multiplayer turn-based browser game set in the universe of [[Fallout 2|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fallout_2]], written by [[Martin Janiczek|https://twitter.com/janiczek]].

[img[Screenshot as of 2021.04.19::001]]

Important links:

* [[Play|https://nu-ashworld.lamdera.app]]
* [[Source code|https://github.com/Janiczek/nu-ashworld]]
* [[Discord|https://discord.gg/HUmwvnv4xV]]
* [[Twitter|https://twitter.com/NuAshworld]]
* [[Reddit|https://www.reddit.com/r/NuAshworld/]]
* [[Donate via Patreon|https://patreon.com/janiczek]]

This wiki can be seen in

* [[static mode|https://janiczek.github.io/nu-ashworld]] (should be faster to load)
* [[dynamic mode|https://nu-ashworld.tiddlyhost.com]] (more features)

As a jumping-off point, continue to one of the pages in the sidebar.
title: NuAshworld

text:
One of the [[SPECIAL]] attributes. As such, its value is always an integer between 1 and 10 inclusive.

In-game description:

<<<
The ability to see, hear, taste and notice unusual things. A high Perception is important for a sharpshooter.
<<<

Affects:

* [[Sequence]] statistic
* [[Pathfinding]] algorithm used on the map
* [[PerceptionLevel]] statistic
* [[FirstAid]] skill
* [[Doctor]] skill
* [[Lockpick]] skill
* [[Traps]] skill
* [[Outdoorsman]] skill

Is affected by:

* [[Gifted]] trait (+1)
title: Perception

text:
Perk is a bonus specialization of your character, most often in the form of a bonus to some of your statistics (eg. [[BonusHthDamage]] or [[EarlierSequence]]). You can choose a new perk every three levels (or every //four// levels if you chose the [[Skilled]] trait when creating your character). Many perks have a [[LevelRequirement]] or an [[AttributeRequirement]] (or both). Some perks have multiple ranks (can be obtained multiple times). [[FutureContent]] as of version [[2021.04.19::001]]. Perks exist behind the scenes but cannot yet be chosen even if you obtain level 3. <$list filter="[tag[Perk]!tag[FutureContent]sort[title]limit[1]]"> List of currently implemented perks:
    <$list filter="[tag[Perk]!tag[FutureContent]sort[title]]">
  • <$link to={{!!title}}><$view field="title"/>
There are [[more perks|https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/Fallout_2_perks#Regular_perks]] in the original Fallout 2 game - they will most likely come with later game updates.
title: Perk

text:
Skills represent your abilities, for example how good you are at [[Throwing]] or [[FirstAid]].

They are percentages ranging between 0% and 300% inclusive, and they're used to:

* roll a [[SkillCheck]] eg. when trying to hit somebody in a fight or trying to lockpick a door
* pass a [[SkillRequirement]] eg. when determining which [[Perks|Perk]] you're eligible for or which [[Dialogue]] options are available to you

List of all skills:

* [[SmallGuns]]
* [[BigGuns]]
* [[EnergyWeapons]]
* [[Unarmed]]
* [[MeleeWeapons]]
* [[Throwing]]
* [[FirstAid]]
* [[Doctor]]
* [[Sneak]]
* [[Lockpick]]
* [[Steal]]
* [[Traps]]
* [[Science]]
* [[Repair]]
* [[Speech]]
* [[Barter]]
* [[Gambling]]
* [[Outdoorsman]]

Note: not all skills are currently useful in the game.
title: Skill

text:
A [[Trait]] affecting your [[Agility]] and [[CarryWeight]].

In-game description:

<<<
You are not quite as big as other people, but that never slowed you down. You can't carry as much, but you are more agile.
<<<

Positive effects:

* +1 [[Agility]]

Negative effects:

* [[CarryWeight]] formula changed from: $$
\mathit{CarryWeight} = 25 + \mathit{Strength} \times 25
$$ to ([[FutureContent]]): $$
\mathit{CarryWeight} = 25 + \mathit{Strength} \times 15
$$
title: SmallFrame

text:
SPECIAL is a set of seven attributes that largely define your character. These are:

* [[Strength]]
* [[Perception]]
* [[Endurance]]
* [[Charisma]]
* [[Intelligence]]
* [[Agility]]
* [[Luck]]

These attributes' values are integers between 1 and 10 inclusive, and they're used to:

* generate your initial [[Skill]] percentages
* pass an [[AttributeRequirement]] eg. when determining which [[Perks|Perk]] you're eligible for
title: SPECIAL

text:
One of the [[SPECIAL]] attributes. As such, its value is always an integer between 1 and 10 inclusive.

In-game description:

<<<
Raw physical strength. A high Strength is good for physical characters.
<<<

Affects:

* [[MaxHitpoints]] statistic
* [[MeleeDamageBonus]] statistic
* [[Unarmed]] skill
* [[MeleeWeapons]] skill

Is affected by:

* [[Bruiser]] trait (+2)
* [[Gifted]] trait (+1)
title: Strength

text:
Trait is a characteristic of your avatar. It usually has a positive and a negative side to it. <<< For example, the trait [[Bruiser]] increases your [[Strength]] by 2 points, but also decreases your [[ActionPoints]] by 2. <<< You can choose up to two traits at the beginning of the game, during the [[CharacterCreation]] process. <$list filter="[tag[Trait]!tag[FutureContent]sort[title]limit[1]]"> List of currently implemented traits:
    <$list filter="[tag[Trait]!tag[FutureContent]sort[title]]">
  • <$link to={{!!title}}><$view field="title"/>
There are [[more traits|https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/Fallout_2_traits#List_of_traits]] in the original Fallout 2 game - they will most likely come with later game updates.
title: Trait

text:
Unarmed is a [[Skill]] related to hand-to-hand [[Combat]].

In-game description:

<<<
A combination of martial arts, boxing and other hand-to-hand martial arts. Combat with your hands and feet.
<<<
title: Unarmed

text: A part of the game that is currently useless. Maybe in the next version!
title: Useless
$:/HistoryList

text: Content original to NuAshworld (not having an equivalent in the Fallout games).
title: NuAshworldOnly
